text: the ambulance services and supporting
people during the night any support
needed by any of our services must be
given and we must support those people
that have suffered so much those
families that have lost young ones those
families that still don't quite know
what is happening with their own
children this is the most terrible and
traumatic time in these circumstances we
have to come together in these
circumstances a city and the community
comes together in solidarity and in
strength so we carry on
we don't allow these attacks from these
people to divide us or prevent us from
leading the decent normal lives that we
all want to lead I spoke to the mayor of
my extremity Burnham about this
overnight as well and he sent out a very
strong statement saying exactly that and
he also thanked cities all around the
world that have sent their solidarity to
Manchester today as indeed I do myself
and your message to the family I'm
terribly sorry
terribly sad for you there can be
nothing worse when you losing a child in
a situation like this we have to put our
arms and land up and support them not
just today but in all the very difficult
days to come because trauma like this
doesn't go in a day or two is there with
them to the rest of their lives we have
to give them all the support we possibly
can and also make sure we live in a safe
environment in the future and we live in
safety together but we do not allow our
communities to be divided by this kind
of appalling atrocious act of violence
